Interface World<E>

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractWorld, LimitedWorld
public interface World<E>

The World interface is implmented by classes in order to give them functionality required by the Game Engime such as GameObject manipulation and handling.

Since:
May 9, 2011
Version:
1.0.0.1 : May 14, 2011
Author:
Mihail Kurbako
See Also:
AbstractWorld, GameObject

Method Summary
 boolean addToWorld(E obj)
          Adds the specified Object to the World.
 boolean existsInWorld(E obj)
          Checks if the specified Object exists within the World.
 java.util.ArrayList<Movable> getAllMovable()
          Used by the Game Engine to find all Movable Objects in this World.
 int getHeight()
          This method is used to retreive the vertical size value that was assigned to this World during instantiation.
 int getWidth()
          This method is used to retreive the horizontal size value that was assigned to this World during instantiation.
 E removeFromWorld(E obj)
          Removes the specified Object from the World if it exists.
 

Method Detail

addToWorld

boolean addToWorld(E obj)
Adds the specified Object to the World. Returns true as specified by the AsbtractList interface.

Parameters:
obj - The Object to be added to the World.
Returns:
true.

existsInWorld

boolean existsInWorld(E obj)
Checks if the specified Object exists within the World.

Parameters:
obj - The Object that this method searches for.
Returns:
true if the Object exists in the World, false otherwise.

removeFromWorld

E removeFromWorld(E obj)
Removes the specified Object from the World if it exists. Returns the removed Object. If it doesn't exist, returns null;

Parameters:
obj - The Object to remove from the World.
Returns:
The Object that was removed from the World if it existed in the World, null

getAllMovable

java.util.ArrayList<Movable> getAllMovable()
Used by the Game Engine to find all Movable Objects in this World. Returns them as an ArrayList\.

Returns:
All instances of Movable in this World Object.

getHeight

int getHeight()
This method is used to retreive the vertical size value that was assigned to this World during instantiation.

Returns:
The current value for the height of this World Object.

getWidth

int getWidth()
This method is used to retreive the horizontal size value that was assigned to this World during instantiation.

Returns:
The current value for the width of this World Object.
